smile.data

Interface BinarySparseDataset

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Dataset<int[]>

    public interface BinarySparseDataset
extends Dataset<int[]>
    Binary sparse dataset. Each item is stored as an integer array, which are the indices of nonzero elements in ascending order.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static BinarySparseDataset from(java.nio.file.Path path)
      Parse a binary sparse dataset from a file, of which each line is a data item which are the indices of nonzero elements.
      default int get(int i, int j)
      Returns the binary value at entry (i, j) by binary search.
      int length()
      Returns the number of nonzero entries.
      int ncols()
      Returns the number of columns.
      static BinarySparseDataset of(java.util.Collection<int[]> data)
      Returns a default implementation of BinarySparseDataset from a collection.
      SparseMatrix toMatrix()
      Returns the Harwell-Boeing column-compressed sparse matrix.

      • Methods inherited from interface smile.data.Dataset

        apply, distributed, get, isEmpty, of, size, stream, toDataset, toMatrix, toString

    • Method Detail

      • length

        int length()
        Returns the number of nonzero entries.

      • ncols

        int ncols()
        Returns the number of columns.

      • get

        default int get(int i,
                int j)
        Returns the binary value at entry (i, j) by binary search.
        Parameters:
        i - the row index.
        j - the column index.

      • toMatrix

        SparseMatrix toMatrix()
        Returns the Harwell-Boeing column-compressed sparse matrix.

      • of

        static BinarySparseDataset of(java.util.Collection<int[]> data)
        Returns a default implementation of BinarySparseDataset from a collection.
        Parameters:
        data - Each row is a data item which are the indices of nonzero elements. Every row will be sorted into ascending order.

      • from

        static BinarySparseDataset from(java.nio.file.Path path)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Parse a binary sparse dataset from a file, of which each line is a data item which are the indices of nonzero elements.
        Parameters:
        path - the input file path.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if stream to file cannot be read or closed.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if an entry is not an integer.
